comments:
I have very strange and annoying error in Eclipse Europa.

Briefly my use case:

1. Download eclipse europa (standard, j2ee - the same behavior)
2. Untar package and cd eclipse
3. ./eclipse (tested with -clean, -consoleLog switches with no clear solution for me)
4. Choose new workspace
4. Eclipse starts with empty project explorer
5. Import existing project (i used many projects including those generated with maven eclipse:eclipse)
6. Project is now available (for example: compilation works)

and now ...

7. Select existing file (java source, text file or anything else)
8. Double click on file ... and now eclipse freezes (source code editor could not get initialized for any type of file)

I tried many other cases with similar behavior ... one week ago everything worked on my previous eclipse europa instance. now it does not :(

i have Gentoo linux and i did not make any system upgrades recently 

debug notes:
- kdesu ./eclipse does not help
- when i used j2ee eclipse instance, i noticed log messages in .log file in workspace directory. I shown some thread deadlocks in Mylyn, but when i use standard eclipse .log file is empty

for sure this is threads issue, but for now i'm not able to tell you more. could you pleas give me some hints how to solve this issue ?

thanks

regards,
Łukasz Wachowcz

This is trace from .log file ...

Hmmmm, i have something ...

accidentally i run Eclipse once more without Internet access ... and it worked. after plugging eth cable in (dhcp assigned internet address) ... problem came back. This is the issue ... but still i don't know how to solve it
Moving to Mylyn since traces show Mylyn threads and timeouts.

Problem is still unresolved, but I can provide one more scenario

1. Unlink eth cable (or turn eth interface off)
2. Open eclipse
3. Open file A (everything works)
4. Open file B
5. Plug cable into eth port (or somehow bring internet connection back)
6. Current file in editor is B, so choose file A tab (still works)
7. Find file C in project browser and double click to open it
....
Eclipse freezes

In addition when i drop internet connection nothing happens, Eclipse still hangs.
I just found this issue using grouping by owner in my Task List. It looks like it fell off the grid because it haven't been reassigned to Mylyn inbox.

Łukasz, could you please try to do a 'killall -3 eclipse' when Eclipse hangs? This will dump the current stack of all threads to the console Eclipse was started from. Please attach the output to this bug report to help us analyze the problem further.

The startup errors you were seeing in the log have been resolved in the latest Mylyn weekly build (bug 188254) which is available here:

 http://www.eclipse.org/mylyn/downloads/
 
It would be very helpful if you could try to capture the stack-dump before upgrading so we can determine the cause of the problem which is most likely not related to the startup warnings.

Steffen,

Thanks for your replay. Following your instructions I replied my test

1. From user console : ./eclipse
2. I have internet connection active and eclipse freezes ...
3. ps -eaf | grep eclipse (i write down pid)
4. kill -3 <pid>

Łukasz, could you verify that printers are correctly setup and in your system and that you get a similar stack trace when opening source files?
